column4: Is it possible for dmesg to get full? And if so, how can i clear it?
its a ring-buffer, will delete oldest entries when full
strange, its is full with some sort of TCP error message and it doesnt show the usb stick i just plugged in
yes, that works, but i am hoping there is a way to mount it properly so i dont have to do that every time i use the disk
you won't need to do it everytime if you've done it right once. permissions will be stored in the filesystem
ah ok, will that also work when i plug the disk in another pc with different users?
it will work for users with the same UID
so if they both have UID=1000 or so the changes will be permanent?
thanks a lot, I spent a lot of time trying to figure out why I couldnt mount it properly. Is this bug or a feature, because I was expecting it to behave as a normal filesystem when you decrypt it.
i have no clue about encrypted fs
i'm sorry, is this the default behavior for ext2 filesystems? because i have no such problem with a fat usb stick
on usb and other external you mostly have vfat/ntfs, which work different
you cannot use unix-permissions on vfat/ntfs, that's why they have special mount-options
I see, thank you very much, you've explained a lot to me in a short time.
